result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Stephen D. Sporle was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Stephen D. Sporle
Current: 15 Harrison Street, #8, Platteville, WI 53818 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2019)
Prior: 6846 Mineral Street, South Wayne, WI 53587

11:03 AM Attorney Curtis Johnson in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of current case status.  Certified DOT record received.  Defendant does not deny the record.  Atty Johnson requests to dismiss w/o prejudice the current petition (in this case) or relief to amend petition in 13CT1.  State does not object to adjournment.  Court will allow withdrawal of petition without prejudice in this case.
Certified Record - DOT
LL/COC called DAs office; DAs office re-sent request through their system.  Per DOT, COC cannot request even though statute reads Clerk to submit request.
Status conference on April 24, 2019 at 11:00 am.

10:43 AM  Attorney Curtis Johnson in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Have not received a copy of Mr. Sporle's driving record.  Can't address record itself until that is received.  Clerk of court did send the petition to the DOT.  Clerk then called the DOT and the DOT stated the DA has to request it.  DA did the make request from DOT.  Statute states request to come from clerk of court, but DOT did not accept that.  Atty Johnson is frustrated with DOT and states they shoud have complied with this back in January.  April 24, 2019 at 11:00 am.  STC.  Clerk of Court to resend request to DOT.  
  Status conference scheduled for April 24, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 1, 2019 at 10:45 am.

ADA Matt Allen appears for the State of Wisconsin, Atty. Curtis Johnson appears in person, no appearance by Stephen Sporle.  Certified driving record not received as of this date.  Ct. stated COC office sent request to DOT.  Ct. sets status for 4/1/2019 at 10:45 a.m.

Clerk fax'd in a request for certified driving record on 02/01/2019.  Follow up call to DOT today.  They did not process request because the request must come in through the DAs office (their program).  According to statute, the clerk is to make the request but DOT informs that it must come in through a program that the COC does not have access to.  Request made to the Iowa County District Attorney's office to send request for certified driving record.
Status conference on March 7, 2019 at 10:30 am.

01:03 PM Defendant Stephen D. Sporle in court with attorney Curtis Johnson.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of current case status.  Petition for Determination of HTO was filed.  Atty Johnson's position is the validity of the record.  Clerk sent for certified driving record, but not yet received.  Court will set further status to allow receipt of the record.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on February 1, 2019 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Petition for Determination of HTO Status
Adjustment Number: 19A 000011, Payable Number: 102929, Amount: $20.00

ADA Matt Allen appears for the State of Wisconsin, Stephen Sporle appears in person.  Ct. hears from ADA Matt Allen and Stephen Sporle re habitual traffic offender.  Currently not eligible for an occupational license until 12/14/2019.  Ct. reviews Ch. 351.027 and confirms sentence is correct.  Ct. denies request and explains def. can retain legal counsel re collateral attack issues.
Status conference on December 3, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

for Ignition Interlock Exemption
*fax'd to the jail @ 3:10 pm*
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Stephen D. Sporle in court with attorney Kyle Robert Reimann.  Defendant Stephen D. Sporle in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends Ct 1 to OWI - 3.  Cts 2-4:  dismissed.  Review of charges and penalties.  Defendant sworn.  PLQ - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  Ct 1 - no contest plea.  Joint recommendation:  95 days jail, concurrent to all other cases and sentences (with stipulated credit - Time Served); $2502.00; $40.50 to MPPD; 24 mo DLR, revocation to begin when the past revocation/suspension began; 24 mo IID; AODA & dsp; DNA submission.
of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kyle Robert Reimann in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim contact needed before PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
of Motion Hearing/Status Conferences on November 10, 2016
Status conference on November 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADA Matt Allen appears for the State.  Atty. Kyle Reimann appears with his defendant, Stephen Sporle, who is in custody.  Motion to collaterally attack previous convictions for 15CF106.  Go to evidentiary hearing.  Mr. Sporle sworn in and testifies. 
State begins questioning.  Ex. 1-Petition for appt. of counsel.  Ex. 2 - Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  Atty. Reimann objects to reviewing exhibits.  ADA Matt Allen explains and Court overrules.  Ex. 3 marked - 1/28/2013 Transcript.  Ex. 4 marked - 1/29/2013 Transcript of initial appearance.  Ex. 5 marked - Complaint of Case No. 13 CT 1.  Ex. 6 marked 2/26/13 transcript.  Ex. 7 marked - Waiver of Right to Atty. form.  Ex . 8 marked - May 21, 2013 transcript.  Exs. 1-8 are offered/received.  Ex. 9 - Waiver of Right to Atty.  Ex. 10 marked - Brief hearing on 7/9/2013 in 13 CT 1 to set plea/sentencing in September, 2013.  Ex. 11 marked - Transcript of hearing of 11/19/2013.  Ex. 12 marked - Email.  Ex. 13 marked-transcript from 10-3-2013 sentencing hearing.  Ex. 14 marked-plea waiver form.  Cross by Atty Reimann.  Brief redirect.  Redirect by Atty. Reimann.  Arguments heard by ADA Matt Allen and Atty. Reimann, rebuttal by Mr. Allen.  All 14 exhibits offered and received.  As to 13CT1court finds def was not properly given his rights, etc., and Court grants motion as brought by Atty. Reimann.  Court hears Reimann, requests bond hearing immediately.  Allen feels cash bond is appropriate and asks that the bond remain as presently set.  Reimann argues that this is now a misdemeanor OWI, give a signature bond or a lower cash bond.  Allen rebutts that there are still 6 felony cases going, and the amount needs to remain.  Court finds that def did not follow the rules and conditions of bond, and denies bond modification.  5:16 pm - hearing adjourned.
